subject: Re: [junit] Unit Testing Database Code/Different RDBMS Systems
msgSnippet: ... If you test a system, it s to be sure that it will run on production. Since every database has its own particularities, there s not advantage on testing
messageBody:
> Will it work OK to use one type of DB in production (Oracle, in my
> case) and another type of DB to test against (something free, like
> mySQL)? I am nowhere near a SQL Guru. Couldn't we have some SQL that
> didn't work for both systems, or is that rare?


If you test a system, it's to be sure that it will run on production.
Since every database has its own particularities, there's not advantage
on testing with mySQL if Oracle is used in the production's enviroment.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
